fatal.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: If it is not treated correctly, the condition can prove fatal  (=be fatal).
fatal.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: having a very bad effect, especially making someone fail or stop what they are doing
fatal.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Telling your employees they’re unimportant is a fatal error.
Disunity finally proved fatal to the rebels’ cause.
There was one fatal flaw  (=serious weakness) in his argument.
His presidential hopes suffered a fatal blow in New Hampshire.
